PerformanceNavigation.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The legacy PerformanceNavigation interface represents information about how the navigation to the current document was done.

blockquote.para:
This interface is deprecated in the Navigation Timing Level 2 specification.
Please use the interface instead.

remarks.para: An object of this type can be obtained by calling the read-only attribute.

-The that allows access to an object of this type.
- (part of Navigation Timing Level 2) that has superseded this API.

PerformanceNavigationRedirectCount.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The legacy
PerformanceNavigation.redirectCount
read-only property returns an unsigned short representing the number of
REDIRECTs done before reaching the page.

blockquote.para:
This interface of this property is deprecated in the Navigation Timing Level 2 specification.
Please use the interface instead.

PerformanceNavigationType.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The legacy
PerformanceNavigation.type
read-only property returns an unsigned short containing a constant
describing how the navigation to this page was done.

blockquote.para:
This interface of this property is deprecated in the Navigation Timing Level 2 specification.
Please use the interface instead.

PerformanceNavigationType.value:
An unsigned short.Possible values are:
NOTEHistorically, developers tested for a type of "TYPE_BACK_FORWARD" to get an indication of back/forward cache ({{glossary("bfcache")}}) hit rate. This however did not provide any reasons for bfcache blocking, or any other data. The property should be used to monitor the bfcache, going forward. See Monitoring bfcache blocking reasons for more information.

summary.blockquote:
WARNINGThis interface of this property is deprecated in the Navigation Timing Level 2 specification. Please use the
interface instead.

remarks.para: The toJSON() method of the interface is a {{Glossary("Serialization","serializer")}}; it returns a JSON representation of the object.

PerformanceNavigationToJSON.returns: A {{jsxref("JSON")}} object that is the serialization of the object.
